授業目的: The purpose of this course is to guide students towards developing a practical mentoring perspective on leadership development, specifically for purposes of preparing for leadership succession in small- or medium-sized enterprises (SMEs), and especially in family-owned businesses.
到達目標:
By participating actively and collaboratively on this course, each student should become able to:

Demonstrate familiarity with key principles and processes of leadership development, and especially in SMEs

Demonstrate a practical understanding of mentoring as an approach towards developing leaders, and specifically towards preparing these leaders for succession in family-owned businesses

Demonstrate skills and competencies relevant towards self-mentoring as an approach towards preparing for succession in family-owned businesses

Demonstrate skills and competencies relevant towards self-mentoring for the purpose of continuing their individual development as business leaders.
授業の概要・背景: Session #1. Leadership: training skills and developing competencies
授業方法: Session #2. Leadership development in SMEs: a resource-based view

第1回: Session #1. Leadership: training skills and developing competencies
第3回: Session #2. Leadership development in SMEs: a resource-based view
第5回: Session #3. The family business as a context for leadership development
第7回: Session #4. Mentoring and coaching for improved leadership performance
第9回: Session #5. How to respond when mentoring for business succession fails?
第11回: Session #6. Self-mentoring for continuing development as a business leader

評価.教科書Required texts0:

The instructor will provide readings texts and case studies in response to the particular study and research interests of participants.
評価.参考文献・資料Reference books0:
·       McCarthy, G. (2014) Coaching and Mentoring for Business (New York: Sage)
In addition to offering critical discussion of a wide range of models and frameworks relevant to practices of mentoring and coaching people in organizations – including particular focus on leadership development - the book is easy to read and can act as a self-help guide to professional and leadership development after students graduate from the module and, ultimately, from IMC.
